content: In the third quarter, our total mobile service revenue increased by 4.2% year-over-year, attributable to the outperforming subscriber number increase and the up-sell resulting from 5G migration. In the third quarter, our fixed broadband business continued its upward trend for 12 consecutive quarters in terms of ARPU growth as total subscriber numbers increased by 0.5% year-over-year. As each business line of Consumer Business Group delivered positive results in the third quarter, total revenue of Consumer Business Group increased by 3.8% year-over-year. Mobile service revenue of Consumer Business Group grew by 5.4% year-over-year, mainly due to the increases of postpaid subscriber number and the 5G migration. In addition, sales revenue of Consumer Business Group increased by 5.4% year-over-year in the third quarter, mainly due to early launch of iPhone series in September with better sales of iPhone 14 high-end models. In the third quarter, Enterprise Business Group maintained its growth trajectory by demonstrating 5.1% revenue increase on a year-over-year basis, mainly attributable to the robust growth of our ICT business. In the third quarter, our total enterprise emerging application revenue increased by 16.1% year-over-year as most of our major applications demonstrated strong performance by exceeding 20% year-over-year growth. In the third quarter, our International Business Group revenue continued to increase by 22.6% year-over-year, maintaining its growth momentum, attributable to the rising demand for IDC and cloud services from global clients. For the third quarter of 2022, total revenues grew by 5.2% on a year-over-year basis, mainly due to increased ICT project completion and higher revenues from core businesses, such as mobile services and broadband access.
